profile and the differences between UNION and UNION ALL is crucial for optimizing query performance.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
Relevant resources:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Snowflake Documentation on UNION: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/operatorscomparison.html#union-union-all-intersect-minus                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Snowflake Documentation on Query Profile: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-query-profile.html                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Which virtual warehouse privilege is required to view a load-monitoring chart?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. MONTTOR<br>B. MODIFY<br>C. OPERATE<br>D. USAGE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>A</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answer is A. MONITOR. Here's why:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
The question asks about the privilege required to view a load-monitoring chart related to a Snowflake virtual                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
warehouse. Load monitoring charts provide insights into warehouse performance, resource consumption, and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
query execution metrics. To access this information, Snowflake employs a specific privilege control.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
The MONITOR privilege grants a user the ability to view the status, metadata, and usage of Snowflake                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
objects, including virtual warehouses. This allows users with the MONITOR privilege to see the operational                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
data needed for load monitoring. They can observe metrics such as query latency, warehouse utilization, and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
resource consumption. MONITOR is a read-only privilege, aligned perfectly with the need to view information.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
MODIFY privilege allows for altering the configuration of a virtual warehouse. It enables actions such as                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
resizing the warehouse or changing its properties. This doesn't align with merely viewing load monitoring                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
charts. The OPERATE privilege, in some cloud contexts, allows for starting, stopping or pausing a service.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
While related to warehouse management, it does not grant the right to view detailed load information. USAGE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
privilege grants the ability to use a specific resource, like a database or schema. It doesn't necessarily give                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
access to performance monitoring data. Thus, USAGE alone isn't sufficient.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
Therefore, the MONITOR privilege is specifically designed to provide visibility into the performance and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
activity of a Snowflake warehouse, making it the correct privilege needed to view a load-monitoring chart.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
Supporting Resources:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
Snowflake Documentation on Warehouse Security:https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/grantprivilege.html                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Snowflake Documentation on Usage Privilege:https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/grant-privilege.html#usage-privilege                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Which use case will always cause an exploding join in Snowflake?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. A query that has more than 10 left outer joins.<br>B. A query that is using a UNION without an ALL.<br>C. A query that has not specified join criteria for tables.<br>D. A query that has requested too many columns of data.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>C</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answer is C: A query that has not specified join criteria for tables. This leads to an exploding join                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
(Cartesian product) because Snowflake, or any relational database, will have to join every row in the first table                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
with every row in the second table when no join condition is specified.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
An exploding join occurs when a join operation results in a significantly larger number of rows in the output                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
than in the input tables. This happens because each row from the left table is matched with every row from                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
the right table, and vice versa. Without a join condition, the database system cannot filter down the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
combinations based on logical criteria related to the data.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
Option A is incorrect because the number of LEFT OUTER JOIN statements does not directly cause an                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
exploding join. While multiple joins can lead to performance issues, the absence of join criteria is the specific                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
culprit for an explosion of data.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Option B is incorrect. UNION without ALL removes duplicate rows from the combined result set. This might                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
lead to performance overhead, but it does not cause an exploding join. UNION ALL simply appends the result                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
sets together without duplicate removal.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Option D is incorrect. Requesting a high number of columns, while potentially affecting query performance                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
due to data transfer overhead, does not inherently cause an exploding join. The amount of data transferred is                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
proportional to the number of rows generated and the width of the columns. However, it's the uncontrolled                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
growth in the row count due to a missing join predicate, that leads to the data explosion.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
An exploding join will lead to extreme processing times and resource consumption. Snowflake's architecture,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
while scalable, is still vulnerable to the cost implications of processing such a large intermediate result. It's                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
crucial to always specify a join predicate (e.g., table1.column_a = table2.column_b) when joining tables in SQL                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
to prevent this issue. In this scenario, Snowflake would perform poorly.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Here are authoritative links for further research:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
Snowflake Documentation - Understanding Query Profile: (Search Snowflake documentation for "Query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Profile" or "Exploding Join" - the search function is more reliable than a direct link to a section)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
SQL JOIN operations: (Search for "SQL JOIN" on general database resources like tutorialspoint, w3schools, or                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
similar).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Which view can be used to determine if a table has frequent row updates or deletes?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. TABLES<br>B. TABLE_STORAGE_METRICS<br>C. STORAGE_DAILY_HISTORY<br>D. STORAGE_USAGE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>B</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answer is B. TABLE_STORAGE_METRICS. This view within Snowflake's Information Schema                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
provides granular details about how storage is utilized by individual tables, including metrics that directly                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
reflect the frequency of row updates and deletes. Specifically, TABLE_STORAGE_METRICS contains                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
columns like modified_rows and deleted_rows, which are cumulative counts reflecting the total number of rows                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
that have been updated or deleted since the table's creation or last truncation. By querying this view over                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
time, analysts can clearly observe trends in data modification and identify tables undergoing significant                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
change. Option A, TABLES, simply provides metadata about tables, not storage metrics. Options C and D,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
STORAGE_DAILY_HISTORY and STORAGE_USAGE, are related to overall storage consumption at the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
account level or across different storage stages, respectively, not specific to row-level modifications of                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
tables. Therefore, only TABLE_STORAGE_METRICS offers the necessary granularity to ascertain if a table                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
experiences frequent row updates and deletes. The modified_rows and deleted_rows columns are crucial in                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
understanding table volatility.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
Relevant documentation:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Snowflake Information Schema: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/info-schema.html                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
TABLE_STORAGE_METRICS view: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/infoschema/table_storage_metrics.html                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
What common query issues can be identified using the Query Profile? (Choose two.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. Data classification<br>B. Exploding joins<br>C. Unions<br>D. Inefficient pruning<br>E. Data masking                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>B, D</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answers are B. Exploding joins and D. Inefficient pruning. The Snowflake Query Profile is a                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
powerful tool for analyzing query performance and identifying bottlenecks.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
Exploding joins (B) occur when a join operation produces a significantly larger result set than the input tables.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
This can be identified in the Query Profile by examining the number of rows processed at each stage of the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
query plan, specifically during join operations. A substantial increase in row count after a join indicates a                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
potential "exploding join," often caused by a missing or poorly chosen join condition, leading to Cartesian                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
products and degraded performance.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
Inefficient pruning (D) refers to the inability of Snowflake to effectively reduce the amount of data it reads                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
from storage due to suboptimal filtering. In the Query Profile, you would look at scan operators or table                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
access portions. If Snowflake scans a substantial portion of the data when a more selective filter should have                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
been applied, it points to inefficient pruning. This could be a result of incorrect filtering predicates, or nonoptimal use of partitioning and clustering.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
Options A, C, and E are incorrect. While data classification (A) is an important security and governance aspect                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
of data, it's not directly identified by the query profile, which focuses on execution. Unions (C) are standard                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
SQL operators that don't inherently point to issues that the profile would highlight beyond general                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
inefficiencies. Similarly, data masking (E) is a security measure that is not related to performance issues                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
shown by the Query Profile. The Query Profile focuses on identifying performance issues in query execution,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
such as exploding joins and inefficient pruning, not data access controls or query logic.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Authoritative Links:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
Snowflake Documentation - Query Profile: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/ui/query-profile.html                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Snowflake Documentation - Understanding the Query Profile: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sqlreference/sql/explain.html                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Snowflake Blog - Optimizing Query Performance: https://www.snowflake.com/blog/optimize-your-snowflake-queries-for-better-performance-and-cost/ ( This link provides general guidance on query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
optimization, including tips related to issues identified by the query profile)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
What does a Query Profile provide in Snowflake?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. A multi-step query that displays each processing step in the same panel.<br>B. A pre-computed data set derived from a query specification and stored for later use.<br>C. A graphical representation of the main components of the processing plan for a query.<br>D. A collapsible panel in the operator tree pane that lists nodes by execution time in descending order for a                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>C</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answer is C: A graphical representation of the main components of the processing plan for a                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
query.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Here's why:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
A Query Profile in Snowflake is a powerful tool specifically designed to visualize and analyze the execution of                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
SQL queries. It provides a detailed breakdown of how Snowflake processes a query, allowing users to identify                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
performance bottlenecks and optimize query execution.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
The core functionality lies in presenting a graphical representation of the query execution plan. This graph                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
outlines the various operations performed by Snowflake, such as scanning data, joining tables, filtering rows,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
and aggregating results. Each operation is represented as a node in the graph.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
By examining the query profile, you can understand the sequence of operations, the resources consumed by                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
each operation (e.g., CPU, memory, disk I/O), and the time spent on each operation. This detailed insight allows                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
you to pinpoint the slowest or most resource-intensive steps in the query.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
Option A is incorrect because it describes a query's overall process, not the profile's function. Option B                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
describes a materialized view, a stored result set, not a query profile. Option D is partially correct in that it                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
mentions execution time, but the profile provides a comprehensive graphical view, not merely a list of nodes.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
Snowflake's documentation emphasizes the visual nature of the Query Profile and its use for performance                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
tuning. It allows users to understand data flow and resource consumption. The graphical format helps to                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
quickly identify areas for optimization by representing steps visually. In essence, the visual breakdown helps                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
in spotting slow operations and inefficiencies.For further reading and authoritative information on Snowflake's Query Profile, you can refer to the official                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Snowflake documentation:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Snowflake Query Profile: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-query-profile.html                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
How can an administrator check for updates (for example, SCIM API requests) sent to Snowflake by the identity                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
provider?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. ACCESS_HYSTORY<br>B. LOAD_HYSTORY<br>C. QUERY_HISTORY<br>D. REST_EVENT_HISTORY
