While                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
the Query Profile does reveal user identity in a more general sense, the details section doesn't typically show                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
the specific role the user held while executing the query. This information is usually found elsewhere, such as                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
in account usage views. The origin of the queried table (source system) isn't displayed in the Query Profile's                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
details. The profile analyzes how Snowflake executed the query, not where the data came from. Similarly, the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
profile primarily focuses on performance metrics related to the execution engine rather than the underlying                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
data structure. While it might indirectly indicate if it processed a variant column, it won't explicitly classify the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
data as structured or semi-structured. Therefore, the most accurate capability offered by the Query Profile                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
details is determining the total query duration.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
Authoritative Links:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
Snowflake Documentation - Query Profile: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-query-profile                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
Snowflake Documentation - Monitoring Query Performance: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/userguide/monitoring-queries                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
What aspect of an executed query is represented by the remote disk I/O statistic of the Query Profile in                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Snowflake?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. Time spent scanning the table partitions to filter data based on the predicate<br>B. Time spent caching the data to remote storage in order to buffer the data being extracted and exported<br>C. Time spent reading and writing data from and to remote storage when the data being accessed does not fit<br>D. Time spent reading and writing data from and to remote storage when the data being accessed does not fit                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>D</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answer is D. "Remote disk I/O" in Snowflake's Query Profile specifically refers to the time spent                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
interacting with Snowflake's remote storage layer, which is typically cloud object storage (like AWS S3, Azure                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Blob Storage, or Google Cloud Storage). This metric measures how long the query spent reading data from, or                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
writing data to, this remote storage. Option A describes time spent filtering data within partitions, an                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
operation typically performed in memory or local disk, not "remote disk." Option B describes caching to                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
remote storage for export/buffering which is not what remote disk I/O refers to as data is being written for an                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
export. Snowflake leverages local disk on the virtual warehouse nodes as a second-level cache and temporary                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
workspace for data that doesnâ€™t fit in memory. Therefore, "remote disk I/O" specifically indicates when the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
data is being read from or written to the persistent remote cloud storage, typically because it couldnâ€™t be held                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
within both the virtual warehouse's memory or its local disk. This I/O activity is a common bottleneck in data                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
warehousing, and understanding this metric helps identify areas where query performance might be improved                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
by optimizing data access patterns, data organization, or the virtual warehouse size. If the remote disk I/O is                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
high, it implies that a lot of data is being fetched from the remote storage, which is slower than accessing                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
data from memory or local disks. Understanding and optimizing remote disk I/O is key to improving query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
performance and reducing cost.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Here are some authoritative links for further research:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Snowflake Documentation on Query Profile: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-query-profile.html                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
(Specifically look for the section on "I/O")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Snowflake Architecture Overview: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/intro-key-concepts.html                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
(Understanding how compute and storage are separated helps clarify why remote I/O exists)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Snowflake Performance Optimization Guide: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/performanceoptimizing.html (This highlights how to use query profile metrics like remote I/O to improve performance)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
</details>

---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Which object-level parameters can be set to help control query processing and concurrency? (Choose two).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. MAX_CONCURRENCY_LEVEL<br>B. DATA_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS<br>C. MIN_DATA_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS<br>D. STATEMENT_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS<br>E. STATEMENT_QUEUED_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>D, E</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answer is D. STATEMENT_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS and E.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
STATEMENT_QUEUED_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS. These are object-level parameters specifically                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
designed to regulate query execution behavior within Snowflake.STATEMENT_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS defines the maximum duration a query is allowed to run                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
before being automatically terminated by the system. This parameter helps prevent runaway                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
queries from consuming excessive resources and potentially impacting other operations. It                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
directly controls processing time.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
STATEMENT_QUEUED_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS sets the maximum time a query can remain in a                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
queue waiting for resources before it is canceled. This helps manage concurrency and avoids                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
indefinite delays when the system is under heavy load. It controls how long a query waits, thus                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
influencing concurrency handling.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Options A, B and C are not object-level parameters that directly influence query processing and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
concurrency control.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
MAX_CONCURRENCY_LEVEL is primarily managed at the account or warehouse level, not                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
directly at the object level. It dictates the maximum number of queries that can run concurrently                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
on a given warehouse.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
DATA_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS and MIN_DATA_RETENTION_TIME_IN_DAYS are related to                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Time Travel and Fail-Safe data recovery features and don't control query processing directly.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
They define the timeframe for which historical data is available and are not connected to query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
execution flow or concurrency management. They are data management, not query processing                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
parameters.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
In summary, STATEMENT_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
STATEMENT_QUEUED_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS are the object-level parameters most relevant                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
for managing query runtime and wait times, thereby contributing to controlling processing and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
concurrency at object level. Other options are related to other aspects of the Snowflake platform.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
For further information, see these Snowflake documentation pages:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Object Parameters: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/parameters.html#objectparameters                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
STATEMENT_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sqlreference/parameters.html#statement-timeout-in-seconds                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
STATEMENT_QUEUED_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sqlreference/parameters.html#statement-queued-timeout-in-seconds                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
What are valid sub-clauses to the OVER clause for a window function? (Choose two.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. GROUP BY<br>B. LIMIT<br>C. ORDER BY<br>D. PARTITION BY<br>E. UNION ALL                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>C, D</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct sub-clauses for the OVER clause in Snowflake window functions are ORDER BY and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
PARTITION BY.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
PARTITION BY divides the rows into partitions based on specified columns. Window functions then                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
operate independently within each partition. This is crucial for tasks like calculating running                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
totals or ranking within categories, effectively isolating calculations to relevant subsets of data.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
It's analogous to a GROUP BY clause, but without aggregating rows down, therefore maintaining                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
data dimensionality.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
ORDER BY within the OVER clause determines the order in which the window function is applied                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
to the rows within each partition. This is essential for functions that rely on a sequence, like                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
calculating moving averages or cumulative sums. Without an ORDER BY, the order of processing                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
is arbitrary, hindering predictability.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
GROUP BY and LIMIT are not valid sub-clauses for OVER. GROUP BY is used for aggregation                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
outside window functions. LIMIT is used for constraining the number of rows returned by the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
query, and not relevant to window function operation within an OVER clause. UNION ALL                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
combines results of two or more queries, it is irrelevant here.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
Therefore, only ORDER BY and PARTITION BY are the correct options to define the windowing                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
behavior for the calculations inside.Authoritative links:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Snowflake Documentation on Window Functions: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sqlreference/functions-analytic                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
Snowflake Documentation on the OVER clause: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sqlreference/constructs/over-clause                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Which types of subqueries does Snowflake support? (Choose two.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. Uncorrelated scalar subqueries in WHERE clauses<br>B. Uncorrelated scalar subqueries in any place that a value expression can be used<br>C. EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses: these subqueries can be uncorrelated only<br>D. EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses: these subqueries can be correlated only<br>E. EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses: these subqueries can be correlated or uncorrelated
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>B, E</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
Snowflake supports several types of subqueries, crucial for complex data analysis and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
manipulation. Uncorrelated scalar subqueries, which return a single value, can be placed                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
wherever a value expression is valid within a query, such as in SELECT lists, WHERE clauses, or                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
HAVING clauses. This flexibility allows for dynamic calculations and comparisons based on                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
results from other queries. Additionally, Snowflake supports EXISTS, ANY/ALL, and IN                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
subqueries specifically within WHERE clauses. These subqueries are powerful for filtering based                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
on the presence, or comparison of values returned by an inner query. Critically, these EXISTS,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
ANY/ALL, and IN subqueries can be either correlated or uncorrelated. This means that the inner                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
subquery may or may not depend on values from the outer query, allowing for sophisticated data                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
filtering. While options C and D limit the usage of EXISTS/ANY/ALL/IN subqueries to only                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
uncorrelated or correlated versions, option E correctly specifies that both correlated and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
uncorrelated forms are supported. Therefore, the correct options are B and E, which are combined                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
in the answer 'BE'.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Snowflake Subqueries DocumentationSnowflake SQL Reference                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
What does the Activity area of Snowsight allow users to do? (Choose two.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. Schedule automated data backups.<br>B. Explore each step of an executed query.<br>C. Monitor queries executed by users in an account.<br>D. Create and manage user roles and permissions.<br>E. Access Snowflake Marketplace to find and integrate datasets.                                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>B, C</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The Activity area within Snowsight is a powerful tool focused on monitoring and analyzing query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
execution within a Snowflake account. Option B is correct because the Activity tab provides a                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
detailed breakdown of individual query execution steps, allowing users to understand                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
performance bottlenecks and optimize their SQL. Users can delve into the query profile,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
identifying which stages took the most time and resources. This is crucial for query tuning and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
troubleshooting.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
Option C is also correct; Activity allows administrators to monitor all queries executed by users                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
within the Snowflake account. This includes details like who executed the query, when, its                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
duration, and the resources it consumed. This monitoring capability is vital for understanding                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
usage patterns, identifying potential security issues, and managing resource consumption. It also                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
facilitates capacity planning and performance analysis. Options A, D, and E are incorrect because                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
they describe functionalities located elsewhere in Snowsight. Data backups are usually                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
configured through other features, role/permission management is found in the Admin area, and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
Snowflake Marketplace access is separate.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
For further research, refer to the official Snowflake documentation:
