Query Profiling in Snowsight: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-snowsight-queryprofile                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Which common query problems can the Query Profile help a user identify and troubleshoot? (Choose two.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. When window functions are used incorrectly<br>B. When there are exploding joins<br>C. When there is a UNION without ALL<br>D. When the SELECT DISTINCT command returns too many values<br>E. When there are Common Table Expressions (CTEs) without a final SELECT statement                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>B, C</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answers are B and C. The Snowflake Query Profile is a powerful tool for analyzing                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
query execution and identifying performance bottlenecks. Exploding joins (B) occur when a join                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
operation unexpectedly produces a significantly larger number of rows than either of the input                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
tables. This leads to excessive processing and can severely impact query performance. The Query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
Profile visually highlights such situations through disproportionately large numbers of processed                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
rows and the presence of a "Join" node that shows the row increase. Using the profile, users can                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
pinpoint the specific join contributing to the issue and then optimize the join conditions or the data                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
itself. Common problems to look for in exploding joins include incorrect join keys, missing filters                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
before the join or duplicate records in joined tables.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Furthermore, the profile helps identify inefficient UNION operations, especially if UNION ALL was                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
intended but UNION was used instead (C). UNION performs a deduplication step, which can be                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
computationally expensive, especially on large datasets. The Query Profile can reveal if this                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
deduplication is the cause of query slow downs. Looking for the Union node in the plan, one can                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
see the number of input rows and the resulting output rows. If UNION is unnecessarily removing                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
duplicate rows that were expected, this indicates the need to switch to UNION ALL. While theQuery Profile provides detailed information on query stages, operations, and their relative                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
performance, it does not directly reveal issues related to incorrect use of window functions (A),                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
large distinct result sets (D), or problems with CTE structure (E) that have an overall impact on                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
result correctness. Although Window functions will appear in the query profile if present, it                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
doesn't directly flag whether they are being used incorrectly. Similarly, SELECT DISTINCT will be                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
present, but any potential slow down due to returning too many values will require manual                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
assessment. Incorrect CTE implementation without a final select statement will cause an error                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
but not a performance issue diagnosable by the profile.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Authoritative Links:

Understanding Joins in Snowflake: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/constructs/jointypes-syntax                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
UNION vs UNION ALL in Snowflake: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/operators-set                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Which table function should be used to view details on a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) run that is presently                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
scheduled or is executing?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. TASK_HISTORY<br>B. TASK_DEPENDENTS<br>C. CURRENT_TASK_GRAPHS<br>D. COMPLETE_TASK_GRAPHS                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>C</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answer is C. CURRENT_TASK_GRAPHS. This table function provides a real-time viewof the actively running or scheduled Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) executions associated with                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
tasks in Snowflake. Unlike TASK_HISTORY, which displays past task executions,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
CURRENT_TASK_GRAPHS focuses on the current state. It allows users to monitor task                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
dependencies, execution order, and overall progress of a DAG while it's in motion. It's crucial for                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
understanding the current state of data pipelines and workflows orchestrated by Snowflake                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
tasks. Options A, B, and D don't show currently active graphs. TASK_HISTORY (A) is for historical                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
runs, TASK_DEPENDENTS (B) for task dependencies and COMPLETE_TASK_GRAPHS (D) shows                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
complete graphs (past runs). Therefore, for observing actively running or scheduled DAGs, the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
CURRENT_TASK_GRAPHS function is the most appropriate choice.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
For further research, refer to the official Snowflake documentation on these table functions:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
CURRENT_TASK_GRAPHS: Learn details on active tasks graphs.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
TASK_HISTORY: Review the execution history of tasks.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
TASK_DEPENDENTS: Check dependencies between tasks.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
COMPLETE_TASK_GRAPHS: Access the complete task graph runs.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
User1, who has the SYSADMIN role, executed a query on Snowsight. User2, who is in the same Snowflake account,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
wants to view the result set of the query executed by User1 using the Snowsight query history.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
What will happen if User2 tries to access the query history?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. If User2 has the SYSADMIN role they will be able to see the results.<br>B. If User2 has the SECURITYADMIN role they will be able to see the results.<br>C. If User2 has the ACCOUNTADMIN role they will be able to see the results.<br>D. User2 will be unable to view the result set of the query executed by User1.                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>D</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answer is D, stating that User2 will be unable to view the result set of User1's query.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
This is because Snowflake's query history access is strictly controlled based on the user who                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
executed the query. Even with administrative roles like SYSADMIN, SECURITYADMIN, or                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
ACCOUNTADMIN, User2 cannot directly access the query history and results of User1 unless                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
granted explicit permissions. Snowflake emphasizes data security and privacy, meaning one                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
user's query results are generally not exposed to others by default. Viewing another user's query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
history and its result set would constitute a significant security vulnerability, potentially exposing                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
sensitive data. The system is designed to prevent unintended or unauthorized access to another                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
user's activities. While administrative roles have broader privileges, these don't automatically                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
grant cross-user query history visibility. Instead, administrators could potentially use specific                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
system functions for auditing or monitoring, but these typically do not provide the same level of                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
direct access to another user's query history within Snowsight. To access another userâ€™s query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
history, specific grants are required using the "GRANT" command, explicitly granting permissions                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
to view certain object types in the userâ€™s session. These grants need to be established in advance                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
to allow User2 to see the query results of User1, and these rights do not exist automatically.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Therefore, User2 lacking these explicit permissions, is blocked from viewing results of queries run                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
by User1.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Authoritative links:

Access Control Overview: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/security-access-controloverview                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
GRANT Syntax: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/grant-privilege                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
The effects of query pruning can be observed by evaluating which statistics? (Choose two.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. Partitions scanned<br>B. Partitions total<br>C. Bytes scanned<br>D. Bytes read from result<br>E. Bytes written                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>A, B</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
Query pruning in Snowflake, a crucial optimization technique, aims to reduce the amount of data                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
that needs to be scanned to fulfill a query, thus improving performance and lowering costs. The                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
effectiveness of this pruning is directly reflected in the number of partitions involved in a query.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
Analyzing "Partitions scanned" (A) and "Partitions total" (B) provides key insights. "Partitions                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
total" represents the entire set of data partitions in the targeted table or tables. On the other                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
hand, "Partitions scanned" indicates the actual number of partitions that Snowflake accessed andprocessed during query execution. A significant difference between the total and scanned                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
partitions demonstrates effective query pruning. The less partitions scanned relative to the total                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
number of partitions the more effective pruning is. Therefore, options A and B accurately                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
represent the key statistics for evaluating the effects of query pruning.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Options C, D and E, while relevant to query performance, do not directly indicate the effectiveness                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
of query pruning. "Bytes scanned" (C) refers to the total amount of data read from storage, which                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
can be affected by various factors beyond pruning and does not directly measure the benefit of                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
the pruning technique. "Bytes read from result" (D) represents the data sent to the user as the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
result of the query, not the data scanned to process it. Lastly, "Bytes written" (E) is not relevant to                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
the initial data retrieval from the table, but relates to the query output or further operations.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Therefore, options C, D, and E are not directly associated with evaluating the effectiveness of                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
query pruning.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
For more information about pruning in Snowflake, consider reviewing the following resources:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Snowflake Documentation on Query Profile: This section will show the scanned partitions metrics                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
and allow you to review the pruning performance in a real world query:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-query-profile                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Snowflake Blog on Query Optimization: This may include details on query pruning strategies and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
impact :https://www.snowflake.com/blog/                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Which Snowflake mechanism is used to limit the number of micro-partitions scanned by a query?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. Caching<br>B. Cluster depth<br>C. Query pruning<br>D. Retrieval optimization                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>C</strong>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
The correct answer is C, Query pruning. Query pruning in Snowflake is a crucial performance                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
optimization mechanism that intelligently reduces the amount of data scanned during query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
execution. Snowflake stores data in micro-partitions, which are immutable storage units. Instead                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
of scanning all micro-partitions, query pruning uses metadata about the data stored within them,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
like min/max values and other statistics, to determine which micro-partitions are relevant to the                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
query's filter conditions (e.g., WHERE clause). This dramatically limits the number of micropartitions that Snowflake actually needs to read and process, significantly accelerating query                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
performance and reducing costs associated with data processing and storage retrieval. Caching                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
(A) helps with repeated queries by storing previously accessed data in faster storage tiers, but                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
doesn't reduce the initial scan of micro-partitions. Cluster depth (B) refers to how deeply a table is                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
clustered based on a specified clustering key, which impacts the order of data within the micropartitions but doesn't directly limit scans. Retrieval optimization (D) is a broader term that might                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
encompass several techniques and isn't a specific Snowflake mechanism for limiting scanned                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
micro-partitions. Query pruning is the specific method that leverages metadata to exclude micropartitions that do not contain relevant data, directly impacting the amount of data read from disk.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
This is a core feature that allows Snowflake to efficiently handle large datasets.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
For further research, refer to the official Snowflake documentation:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
Search Optimization Service: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/search-optimizationservice (while focused on search optimization, it discusses pruning concepts)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Understanding Snowflake Table Structures: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/tablesstructure (provides background on micro-partitions)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Clustering Keys: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/tables-clustering-keys (explains how                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
clustering works, impacting pruning)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
</details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
---                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
What does the TableScan operator represent in the Query Profile?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
A. The access to a single table<br>B. The access to data stored in stage objects<br>C. The list of values provided with the VALUES clause<br>D. The records generated using the TABLE(GENERATOR(...)) construct                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<details>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
<summary><strong>âœ… Answer : </strong></summary>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
<strong>A</strong>
